_source.text: Abs--simple is better the basic crunch (knees bent, feet on the floor, lifting your upper body to the ceiling) produce the strongest contractions in the upper and lower abs...you can add resistance to this exercise as well (light weights or a small medicine ball work best)/ Charlottesville, Virginia : Do you have any thoughts on the use of policosanol, (derived from sugar cane), along with exercise to lower cholesterol and lose weight?

text: Abs--simple **is** **better** the basic crunch (knees bent, feet on the **floor**, lifting your upper body to

_source.text: 2x12 is better, because it gives you more room as I stated before, to allow the proper duct runs and plumbing if needed, so you are not cramming the mechanical's in between the ceiling of the floor below, and the sub-floor of the room you are creating.
